pages.text: Now that you have an instrument and switchboard created let's play a song! MIMI provides the MIDI Transmitter item which allows you to load MIDI files from your system into a playlist to transmit to nearby instruments including your own.

pages.title: Crafting and Opening
pages.text: $(br)Once you've crafted the MIDI Transmitter as shown above simply hold it in your main hand and right click to open the Transmitter GUI.

pages.title: The Transmitter GUI
pages.text: You should now see the Transmitter GUI on your screen.$(br2)This GUI lets you select a folder on your system from which to load MIDI files and then displays all loaded files in a playlist. Use the media control buttons in the bottom left to control playback of the playlist.

pages.title: The Transmitter GUI
pages.text: The buttons to the right of the media controls allow you to toggle the song loop mode (loop single, loop all, and no loop), toggle shuffle on and off, and toggle the Transmit Mode (public, linked, and self).$(br2)The area below the playlist shows the instrument-channel-mapping for the current song which can help give you an idea of which MIDI channels you should enable on your instrument(s).

pages.title: Playing with Others
pages.text: To play songs with other players set your MIDI Transmitter transmit mode to public. This will allow any instrument within 16 blocks of you to receive the notes you are transmitting if they have a Switchboard inserted with 'Public Transmitters' set as the Linked Transmitter and the relevant channels enabled.
